trial_identification.studytitle: Physiotherapy in bronchiectasis after removal of foreign body: case report
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Report of a man of 68 years, with bronchiectasis underwent physiotherapy after removal of foreign body by bronchoscopy, achieving satisfactory results as bronchial hygiene, atelectasis reexpansion of areas, improving lung function and increased physical strength after the intervention.
trial_identification.secondaryid: 3508/2010 Ethics Committee of the Faculdade de Medicina de Rio Preto FAMERP

interventions.interventions: Underwent 20 sessions lasting 45 minutes, 05 days per week, with the techniques applied on the same day: postural drainage associated with inhalation therapy (15 minutes), chest percussion (05 minutes), vibro during exhalation associated with maneuver negative pressure during inspiration (05 minutes), an incentive spirometer (03 sets of 08 repetitions with 01-minute intervals), raising exercise inspiratory flow (03 sets of 02 minutes and 01 minutes of rest between sets); in sitting position oscillating positive pressure (03 minutes), positive expiratory pressure mask airway (10 minutes), manual assisted cough (05 reps with 30 second intervals); After 20 sessions the patient was included in a Pulmonary Rehabilitation program for more than 20 sessions 45 minutes, 05 times per week, consisting of expiration and inspiration in times short (03 sets of 08 repetitions with 01 minutes intervals), heating and conditioning on a treadmill (20 minutes), diaphragmatic breathing (03 sets of 08 repetitions with 01 minute interval).

primaryOutcome.outcome: reexpansion of the area atelectasis and improves the function of the left lung measured by computed tomography.
Increased physical strength when measured by the Walk Test in Six Minutes.
Improved quality of life by Short Form Health Survey Questionnaire in functional capacity, vitality, mental health, social aspects, reduction of the physical limitations and emotional problems.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: improving lung function by peak flow, and the manometer.
improvement of physical strength by the six-minute walk test.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Carrier bronchiectasis after removal of foreign body
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Carrier bronchiectasis home without foreign body

trial_design.concealment: Study with commitment and clear to the patient, with liberty to quit the study at the time thought necessary.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Street Joaquim Manoel Pires, 333, ap. 11, Sao Manoel, Sao Jose do Rio Preto, Sao Paulo, CEP 15091-210

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The aim of this study is to report the case of a man with bronchiectasis after removal of a foreign body underwent chest physiotherapy.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: ethics committee on research of Faculdade de Medicina de Rio Preto
